title: IDO ROI Simulator Education
subtitle: Learn how to use our simulator to make informed token investment decisions. No prior crypto knowledge required.
description: Learn everything you need to know about token investments, unlock schedules, and how to interpret the results from our simulator.

ido.title: What is an IDO?
ido.content: An Initial DEX Offering (IDO) is a fundraising method in which new projects sell their tokens through decentralized exchanges. Unlike ICOs, IDOs offer immediate liquidity and typically lower costs.

roi.title: Understanding ROI
roi.content: Return on Investment (ROI) measures the profitability of an investment as a percentage of the original cost. In crypto, ROI is affected by token price changes, unlock schedules, and market conditions.

fdv.title: Fully Diluted Valuation (FDV)
fdv.content: FDV represents the theoretical value of a token if its entire supply were in circulation at the current price. It's a maximum valuation metric that often creates unrealistic expectations.

supply.title: Token Supply Metrics
supply.content: Total supply refers to all tokens that will ever exist, while circulating supply represents tokens currently available in the market. The difference is often locked or vesting.

unlocks.title: Token Unlocks
unlocks.content: Token unlocks refer to the scheduled release of previously locked tokens into circulation. Unlocks often increase selling pressure and may negatively impact token price.

vesting.title: Vesting Schedules
vesting.content: Vesting is the process by which tokens are gradually released to investors, team members, or other stakeholders according to a predetermined schedule.

scenarios.title: Market Scenarios
scenarios.content: Our simulator allows you to model bearish, neutral, and bullish market conditions to see potential outcomes across different market environments.

exit.title: Planning Your Exit
exit.content: Use unlock schedule data to identify potential sell pressure periods and plan your exit strategy accordingly.

interpretation.title: Interpreting Results
interpretation.content: Learn how to read the simulation results and apply insights to your investment strategy.

dca.title: Dollar-Cost Averaging
dca.content: Instead of investing all at once, consider spreading your investment across multiple entry points to reduce the impact of volatility.

risk.title: Risk Management
risk.content: Never invest more than you can afford to lose, and consider diversifying across multiple projects.

research.title: Due Diligence
research.content: Always research the team, technology, and tokenomics of a project before investing.

cta.title: Ready to Plan Your Investment?
cta.description: Now that you understand how the simulator works and what the parameters mean, try it out with your own investment details.

intro.title: What is the IDO ROI Simulator?
intro.paragraph1: The IDO ROI Simulator is a tool that helps you predict the potential return on investment (ROI) for token presales and Initial DEX Offerings (IDOs). It takes into account token unlock schedules, vesting periods, and various market scenarios to give you a realistic view of your investment potential.
intro.paragraph2: Unlike simplified calculators that only consider fully diluted valuation (FDV), our simulator shows you exactly when your tokens will become available and what your returns might look like under different market conditions.

whyMatters.title: Why this matters:
whyMatters.content: Many investors are disappointed with their IDO returns because they don't account for token vesting schedules and changing market conditions. This simulator helps you set realistic expectations and make better investment decisions.

step1.title: Enter Your Investment Details
step1.description: Input the token price, your investment amount, and the number of tokens you'll receive. These values should be available in the project's documentation or investment portal.

step2.title: Specify the Token Unlock Schedule
step2.description: Enter the TGE % (tokens available at launch), cliff period (waiting time before more tokens unlock), and vesting period (how long until all tokens are released).

step3.title: Set Price Targets for Different Market Scenarios
step3.description: Define your expected token prices under bear (pessimistic), base (realistic), and bull (optimistic) market conditions.

example.title: Example:
example.bearPrice: Bear: $0.08 per token (60% increase from IDO price)
example.basePrice: Base: $0.15 per token (200% increase from IDO price)
example.bullPrice: Bull: $0.50 per token (900% increase from IDO price)

step4.title: Analyze the Results
step4.description: Review the generated unlock schedule, monthly ROI breakdown, and overall return projections under each market scenario.

keyInsights.title: Key insights to look for:
keyInsights.breakEvenPoint: When you'll break even on your investment
keyInsights.tokenUnlocks: How token unlocks affect your total holdings over time
keyInsights.maxPotentialROI: Maximum potential ROI under different market conditions

tokenPrice.name: Token Price
tokenPrice.description: The price per token during the presale or IDO. This is how much you pay for each token.
tokenPrice.tips: Usually much lower than the expected listing price on exchanges.

investmentAmount.name: Investment Amount
investmentAmount.description: The total amount of money you invest in the token sale.
investmentAmount.tips: Only invest what you can afford to lose.

tgePercent.name: TGE %
tgePercent.description: The percentage of your total token allocation released immediately at the Token Generation Event.
tgePercent.tips: Lower TGE % means more tokens are locked in vesting.

cliffPeriod.name: Cliff Period
cliffPeriod.description: A period after TGE during which no additional tokens are unlocked.
cliffPeriod.tips: Longer cliffs can be riskier as you can't sell during this time.

vestingPeriod.name: Vesting Period
vestingPeriod.description: The total duration over which your remaining tokens (after TGE) will be gradually unlocked.
vestingPeriod.tips: Shorter vesting periods are generally better for investors.

totalTokenSupply.name: Total Token Supply
totalTokenSupply.description: The total number of tokens that will ever exist for this project.
totalTokenSupply.tips: Used to calculate the fully diluted valuation (FDV).

bearPrice.name: Bear Price
bearPrice.description: The estimated token price in a negative market scenario.
bearPrice.tips: Always plan for this scenario to assess your risk.
bearPrice.example: $0.08 per token (60% increase from IDO price)

basePrice.name: Base Price
basePrice.description: The estimated token price in a neutral market scenario.
basePrice.tips: This is the most likely outcome in many cases.
basePrice.example: $0.15 per token (200% increase from IDO price)

bullPrice.name: Bull Price
bullPrice.description: The estimated token price in a positive market scenario.
bullPrice.tips: Be realistic - not every project will do 100x.
bullPrice.example: $0.50 per token (900% increase from IDO price)

ido.definition: Initial DEX Offering - A fundraising method where new cryptocurrency projects sell tokens directly through decentralized exchanges.

roi.definition: Return on Investment - The profit or loss from an investment expressed as a percentage of the initial cost.

tge.definition: Token Generation Event - The moment when a project's tokens are created and distributed to initial investors.

tgePercent.definition: The percentage of your total token allocation that becomes available at the Token Generation Event.

cliff.definition: A period after TGE during which no tokens are unlocked.

vesting.definition: The process of gradually releasing tokens over time according to a predetermined schedule.

vestingPeriod.definition: The total duration over which all tokens will be released.

fdv.definition: Fully Diluted Valuation - The theoretical value of a cryptocurrency project if all tokens were in circulation.

marketCap.definition: The total value of all circulating tokens, calculated by multiplying the current price by the circulating supply.

bearMarket.definition: A market condition in which prices are falling and investor confidence is low.

baseMarket.definition: A market condition with moderate growth, representing the expected average case scenario.

bullMarket.definition: A market condition in which prices are rising and investor confidence is high.

unlockSchedule.definition: The timeline detailing when tokens are released from vesting restrictions and become available for trading.

breakEvenPoint.definition: The point at which the returns from an investment equal the cost of the investment.

mistake1.title: Ignoring Vesting Schedules
mistake1.description: Many investors focus only on the initial price without considering how token unlocks affect their actual returns. Remember that you can only sell tokens once they're unlocked, and by then, market conditions may have changed.

mistake2.title: Overestimating Market Performance
mistake2.description: It's tempting to focus only on bull market scenarios, but reality often falls somewhere between base and bear cases. Always consider all scenarios when making investment decisions.

mistake3.title: Not Understanding FDV (Fully Diluted Valuation)
mistake3.description: Projects often promote their current valuation without mentioning the fully diluted valuation, which includes all tokens that will eventually enter circulation. This can lead to price surprises when more tokens are unlocked.

mistake4.title: Forgetting About Other Investors' Unlocks
mistake4.description: Your tokens aren't the only ones being unlocked. When VCs, team members, and other early investors' tokens unlock, they may sell, creating downward price pressure at specific times.

resources.title: Additional Resources
resources.description: Want to learn more? Check out these resources:
